intro: Brassica nervosa, commonly known as the slender mustard, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring linear leaves with prominent veins. Its flowers are usually yellow or pale yellow, and it produces small, round seeds in its fruiting bodies. Brassica nervosa is often found in grasslands and disturbed soils, and it is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
